title: Allston Car Wash employees still in federal custody after ICE raid
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Nine employees with work permits at Allston Car Wash were detained by ICE agents on November 4.
ICE has not responded to inquiries regarding the employees' detention status, according to their attorney Todd Pomerleau.
Some detainees report mistreatment at ICE facilities; legal efforts are underway, including a team of lawyers and family meetings.

title: ‘SNL’ recap: Best moments from Nikki Glaser hosting ‘Saturday Night Live’
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Nikki Glaser hosted the fifth episode of SNL's 51st season on November 8, with musical guest Sombr.
Glaser gained fame from a 2024 Tom Brady roast and hosted the Golden Globes, among other events.
Highlights included Glaser's monologue, Sombr's performances, and Pete Davidson on 'Weekend Update.'

title: Watch: Fraser Minten scores game-sealing goal for Bruins against his former team
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Fraser Minten scored a game-sealing goal for the Boston Bruins in a 5-3 win over the Toronto Maple Leafs.
Minten, a former Toronto prospect, was traded to Boston as part of a deal involving Brandon Carlo last season.
Boston's victory extended their winning streak to six games, with Minten lauded by coach Marco Sturm as the game's best player.

title: Bruins legend Zdeno Chara describes ‘surreal’ induction into Hockey Hall of Fame
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Zdeno Chara was formally inducted into the Hockey Hall of Fame on Saturday in Toronto.
Chara shared the induction weekend with fellow Bruin Joe Thornton, both part of the 2025 class.
Chara, a Stanley Cup champion, was a Bruins captain for 14 years and won the Norris Trophy in 2008-09.

title: What insiders are predicting for the Red Sox in free agency this offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Red Sox have $219 million in payroll, $25M below first luxury tax threshold, for potential free agent signings.
Insiders see Boston as a contender to sign free agents like Alex Bregman and Kyle Schwarber this offseason.
The Red Sox could pursue top international free agent Munetaka Murakami or pitchers Dylan Cease and Framber Valdez.

title: Review & setlist: John Legend was a legendary pro at MGM Fenway (and he knew it)
author: Marc Hirsh
bullets: John Legend performed at MGM Music Hall at Fenway on November 7, 2025, for his 20th anniversary concert.
The concert featured a mix of songs from his debut album 'Get Lifted' and covers of various artists.
Legend showcased his musical versatility with an eclectic setlist, concluding with the encore 'All Of Me.'

title: Jaylen Brown seemingly criticizes officiating again following Celtics’ loss to Magic
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jaylen Brown criticized NBA officiating after the Celtics' 123-110 loss to the Magic, hinting at biased calls.
Brown's earlier remarks on officiating, specifically against the Jazz, did not result in a fine despite harsh criticism.
In the game against Magic, Brown scored 32 points, but struggled in the fourth quarter, going 1-of-5 from the field.

title: 5 things to know about Buccaneers ahead of Sunday’s game vs. Patriots
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Baker Mayfield leads the Buccaneers with a 6-2 record, throwing 13 touchdowns and two interceptions this season.
Rookie Emeka Egbuka has 562 receiving yards and five touchdowns, despite injuries impacting his early season momentum.
Buccaneers defense, ranked seventh in DVOA, is highlighted by standout performances from Jamel Dean and Antoine Winfield Jr.

title: Patriots’ return to relevance includes appearance by Jim Nantz in TV booth to call game for CBS
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Jim Nantz and Tony Romo will call the New England Patriots vs. Tampa Bay Buccaneers game on CBS after a two-year hiatus.
The Patriots-Buccaneers game was chosen over the initially scheduled Bills-Dolphins game due to Miami's poor 2-7 season record.
Nantz expressed interest in calling Drake Maye's game, having known him through their mutual agent, Alan Zucker.

title: Magic pull away, beat Celtics despite another big Jaylen Brown game: 8 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: The Boston Celtics lost 123-110 to the Orlando Magic despite Jaylen Brown scoring 32 points on 15-for-28 shooting.
The Celtics' centers struggled, with Luka Garza recording a -16 in 13 minutes, and the team's defense allowed high Magic scoring.
Payton Pritchard improved his 3-point shooting, finishing 5-for-8 from deep, contributing 27 points on 8-for-16 shooting.
